items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: U.S. appeals court declines to let Trump remove Fed Governor Cook
items.summary: The U.S. Senate narrowly confirmed Stephen Miran to the Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors

items.title: Devadasi survey begins in Karnataka amid confusion over documents to be provided
items.summary: The third survey of devadasis in Karnataka commenced on Monday amid confusion over the list of documents sought by the government to establish the identity

items.title: Pilot unions and aviation regulator gear for clash over fatigue
items.summary: Unions reject data driven method for monitoring pilot fatigue; say India not ready, calls it attempt to side-step Court ordered time limits on duty hours

items.title: China says intercepted Philippine ships at disputed South China Sea shoal
items.summary: China approved plans to turn Scarborough Shoal into a national nature reserve last week, without announcing its specific boundaries.

items.title: Governor Nazeer calls women’s empowerment a key to an inclusive democracy
items.summary: Women’s conclave provides a platform for cultural exchange

items.title: Morning Digest: ITR filing deadline extended till today; NH-2 won’t reopen till pact is reached with Meitei people, say Kuki-Zo Council, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

items.title: Kolkata social workers call on journalists to protect child dignity and rights while reporting
items.summary: At a media sensitisation meet, experts stress that reporting on children must balance public interest with privacy, consent, and long-term wellbeing

items.title: Rajalakshmi Institute of Technology launches Quantum Research Center
items.summary: Higher Education Minister Govi. Chezhiaan highlighted RIT’s efforts in empowering first-generation learners and rural students, and described the Quantum Research Center as a visionary initiative.

items.title: Chennai Mayor reviews progress of Budget announcements
Stalin, Deputy CM commend Vaishali on defending title at FIDE Women’s Grand Swiss
Vijay hails Supreme Court’s partial stay on Waqf (Amendment) Act
The eternal Ramayana
U.S. won’t hit China with tariffs over Russian oil unless Europe goes first: Treasury chief Bessent
items.summary: U.S. Treasury Secretary urges European countries to impose tariffs on China and India to cut off Russian oil revenue

items.title: More reports migrants from West Bengal being harassed, TMC MP meets affected families
items.summary: Reports of migrant worker harassment in Non-BJP ruled States like Tamil Nadu and Jharkhand prompt West Bengal Government intervention and support initiatives

items.title: Bihar Minister announces laptops for top engineering, polytechnic students
items.summary: At present, the award carries a medal, certificate, memento and cash reward of ₹5,000, ₹4,000 and ₹3,000 for students securing first, second and third position at state level in engineering and polytechnic colleges

items.title: More than 6 million children in Maharashtra have non-communicable diseases, say experts
items.summary: The burden is not just medical but social and financial and parents are pushed into debt for recurring costs and children suffer isolation in schools, say doctors

items.title: U.S. military again targeted boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela: Trump
Will try to clear Bhalswa dump in a year, says Khattar
items.summary: The Union Urban Affairs Minister urges citizens and political leaders to adopt old dumpsites, remove the waste, and put the land to productive uses

items.title: Malaria cases at a five-year high of 297
‘Black crust’ forming on Red Fort walls due to pollution: study
Use of money, muscle power in DUSU polls must end: Delhi HC
items.summary: Court flags use of luxury vehicles, tractors in campaign, says it will treat violations as contempt; Cong. leaders Sachin Pilot, Devender Yadav visit North Campus, seek support for NSUI candidates

items.title: Odisha attracted investment of ₹5.6 lakh crore, created 1.64 lakh jobs in 15 months, says CM
items.summary: Foundation stones for 27 industrial projects across 12 districts entailing investment of ₹25,000 crore laid virtually by State CM Mohan Majhi

items.title: More 50,000 senior citizens will be added to pension scheme: Delhi CM
items.summary: Ms. Gupta also informed that an estimated budget of about ₹149 crore has been allocated under this scheme for the financial year.

items.title: Teenager arrested after 15-year-old dies in Manchester stabbing
items.summary: Police had reports of a "disturbance" on Monday and found a teenager with stab wounds.

items.title: Normal rainfall during southwest monsoon in Chennai, says Regional Meteorological Centre
items.summary: However, these numbers are not final and are bound to change since the end of the season is September 30. Meanwhile, the southwest monsoon began its withdrawal from Rajasthan on Sunday

items.title: Ganesapuram subway to be operational soon; residents seek long-term solutions
Commuters want subway at Pattabiram railway station
Mason: Reform UK amplifies existing jitters for Labour and Conservatives
items.summary: The BBC's political editor says people at the top of government acknowledge the last few weeks have been dreadful for them.

items.title: ANMs protest excessive digital reporting, seek workload cut
Press Club of India asks A.P. Chief Minister to stop police from targeting journalists
items.summary: Says media fraternity is concerned by what they called ‘systematic hounding’ of the editor and journalists of Sakshi newspaper by A.P. Police for publishing routine news

items.title: CCMB scientists crack cells’ secret to shape-shifting
items.summary: When a cell needs to form a new shape or protrusion, it must generate a fresh meshwork of actin that pushes in the desired direction

items.title: Hyderabad floods: Parsigutta families escaped death by a whisker
items.summary: Decrepit retaining wall, part of which lay as a heap of heavy boulders now, hardly protected their homes, because water oozed from the catch-pits and flowed as a current from upper regions

items.title: Strengthening Kerala’s secular legacy
items.summary: Sabarimala’s inclusivity stands in opposition to sectarian narratives

items.title: Mark Ronson on being a night person - and Lady Gaga trashing his car
items.summary: Mark Ronson looks back on a troubled childhood, and how it informed his career as a DJ and producer.

items.title: Tejashwi Yadav slams Bihar Minister for ‘assaulting’ Youtuber
items.summary: The RJD leader alleged that the YouTuber, Dilip Kumar Sahani, was beaten up and abused by the Minister for asking questions on the poor condition of the roads

items.title: Haryana farmers protest against ‘inept’ handling of flood situation
items.summary: They demanded immediate steps to remove water from the fields, increased compensation for damaged crops and houses, financial assistance to landless labourers, MGNREGS works, ration for displaced families and other relief measures

items.title: Nainar Nagenthran, Vijay pay tribute to Annadurai
ED restores immovable properties of jewellery shop to SBI in a bank fraud case
Ready for an autumn declutter? Four ways to get started
items.summary: As summer draws to a close, we explore BBC Woman's Hour's expert strategies to help us declutter.

items.title: Patients recovering well after heart transplant at Kochi hospital
ITR filing deadline extended by a day to September 16
items.summary: The extension in the ITR deadline came after chartered accountants and individuals took to social media to complain of glitches on the e-filing portal

items.title: Telangana Medical Council not competent to act against Ayurvedic doctors practising allopathic medicine: HC
As monsoon retreats, Kerala likely to see below-normal rainfall
items.summary: The State has received a total of 1,612.6 mm of rainfall as of September 15 against the seasonal average of 1,888.2 mm of rain, a shortfall of 15%

items.title: DKS announces plan to open new town planning college
Govt. names advisory and pastor welfare panels
items.summary: Cardinal Antony Poola,  Metropolitan Archbishop of Hyderabad and Rev Reuben Mark, Moderator of Church of South India named members of Advisory panel

items.title: 'Crisis for PM grows' and Owen Cooper wins Emmy at 15
items.summary: The papers say there is increasing pressure on the Keir Starmer following his third "political crisis" in 10 days.

items.title: Canara Bank moves its corporate website to a secure domain to ensure more safety
60% of deaths in India linked to lifestyle diseases: C.N. Manjunath
Newly proposed 30% export duty will further hurt Karnataka’s iron ore, steel sectors: FIMI
items.summary: The Centre’s recent proposal to fix export duty on low-grade iron ore at 30% from the earlier 0% will only worsen the situation of both mining and steel production in Karnataka

items.title: Sharad Pawar slams CM Fadnavis for ‘ignoring’ plight of farmers, says ‘learn’ from Nepal’s situation
items.summary: NCP-SP chief said CM Devendra Fadnavis should “learn” from Nepal’s political situation; he said his party will not be a “bystander” if the government does not address the State’s farm distress

items.title: Proposals for real-time traffic management remain in limbo as Kozhikode still relies on outdated signals
Books worth ₹1 crore sold at Madurai Book Festival
Expert committee constituted for exploring the use of Artificial Intelligence in healthcare, says T.N. Health Minister Ma. Subramanian
items.summary: The Tamil Nadu Medical Services Corporation is in the process of leveraging AI for the detection of tuberculosis by analysing X-rays. AI also has a role in early detection of cancer, he says

items.title: BJP will be wiped out from U.P. in 2027 Assembly polls, says Akhilesh
items.summary: The Samajwadi Party chief says the State government is not running as per the Constitution and law and the BJP is working like a gang. The BJP government has ruined education, health, and law and order, he says.

items.title: Watch: Portraying Gandhi is a huge commitment: Pratik Gandhi | TIFF 2025
items.summary: Film critic Meenakshi Shedde caught up with Hansal Mehta, producer Sameer Nair and lead actors Pratik Gandhi and Bhamini Oza in Toronto.

items.title: Myanmar junta says no voting in dozens of constituencies
items.summary: Monitors are slating the poll as a ploy to legitimise continuing military rule, while it is set to be boycotted by many ousted lawmakers and blocked by armed opposition groups in enclaves they control.

items.title: Why Trump's state visit is mired with potential pitfalls despite careful planning
items.summary: Months of planning have gone into the state visit - but the Lord Mandelson question is not the only concern troubling insiders.

items.title: Family stage protest with woman’s body
items.summary: Police book twelve persons in the case so far

items.title: Two killed, several injured as truck runs over people in Indore; vehicle catches fire
items.summary: Police officer says the truck driver has been detained; a video of the vehicle engulfed in fire on a busy road of the city also surfaced online

items.title: Factionalism in Congress exposed by alleged suicides in Wayanad
31 TTP militants killed in northwestern Pakistan in military ops: Army
items.summary: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that Afghanistan must choose between siding with terrorists or standing with Pakistan.

items.title: Residents complain of sewage overflowing onto street in Sellur
Aligarh court rejects police closure report against RJD spokesperson accused of tearing Manusmriti on live TV
items.summary: The court’s order came on a protest petition filed by Bharat Tiwari, secretary of the Rashtriya Savarna Parishad

items.title: Palaniswami talks tough on the issue of readmission of AIADMK’s former leaders
Government to release ₹600 crore for RTF; Federation calls off stir
items.summary: The ₹600 crore being released is towards the already generated tokens and future payments will be streamlined to avoid accumulating dues, Deputy Chief Minister Bhatti Vikramarka said

items.title: 1 crore SVAMITVA property cards to be distributed to owners by March 2026
items.summary: These legal ownership documents help reduce land disputes, enable villagers to access bank loans by monetising property, and strengthen panchayat-level governance through reliable property registers, says SVAMITVAA Director

items.title: Father raises suspicion over death of Jadavpur University student, police presses murder charges
items.summary: Arnab Mondal, the father of the deceased third year English Honours student, says his daughter did not know how to swim, and asks why she would go to the edge of the waterbody on the campus around 10 p.m.

items.title: Kashmir’s fruit markets shut down over prolonged highway closure
items.summary: Parcel train service launched to take apples from Valley to New Delhi; However, fruit growers say it is inadequate as huge stocks remain stranded on roads; CM blames Centre for delay in road work

items.title: Watch: ‘Old templates won’t work with China’, says T.S. Tirumurti on India-China ties
items.summary: The launch of China: Indian Perspectives by The Hindu Publishing Group, curated by Ananth Krishnan, saw former Indian UN envoy T.S. Tirumurti speak on rethinking India’s China strategy. The event was also attended by N. Ram, Nirmala Lakshman, B. Santhanam, Suresh Nambath, Narayan Lakshman, and Stanl

items.title: UGC gets 8 weeks to include norms on tackling caste bias
items.summary: The top court was hearing a plea filed by the mothers of Rohith Vemula and Payal Tadvi, who died by suicide after facing caste-based harassment at their colleges

items.title: Fraudster dupes man of ₹3 crore
Centre faces backlash for blocking Sikh pilgrims’ visit to Nankana Sahib in Pakistan
items.summary: In communication to State governments, the Ministry of Home Affairs said, “taking into account the prevailing security scenario with Pakistan, it would not be possible to send Sikh pilgrims Jatha to Pakistan”

items.title: SC on anticipatory bail in caste crime
items.summary: Supreme Court cancels anticipatory bail granted to a caste crime accused, upholding Section 18 of the SC/ST Act; the ruling reinforces protection for Dalit victims, bars pre-trial relief, and warns courts against conducting a ‘mini-trial’ at the bail stage

items.title: KNRUHS opens first phase of MBBS counselling in Telangana, web options from September 16 to 18
From October 1, only Aadhaar users can book reserved train tickets online during first 15 minutes
items.summary: The tickets can be booked through the website of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) and its app

items.title: Capital Hospital doctors perform high-risk heart surgery on 40-year-old man
ED says it has secured over 94% conviction rate in PMLA cases
items.summary: The central probe agency has set the target of achieving ₹15,000-crore restitution this financial year

items.title: Hotel worker slits customer’s throat, out of danger
Engineers play significant role in nation-building, say experts
items.summary: They recall the historical contributions of engineers in irrigation projects and industrial growth of the country and make special references to projects such as Himayatsagar Dam and Srisailam Dam

items.title: New lab to help carry out crucial tests related to organ transplant
Congress accuses government of ‘gifting’ 1,050 acres of land in Bihar’s Bhagalpur to Gautam Adani
items.summary: At a press conference in Delhi, senior Congress leader Pawan Khera accused the government of withdrawing from the project in favour of Adani

items.title: US destroys alleged Venezuelan drug boat, killing three
items.summary: The attack came after the Venezuelan president said Caracas would defend itself against US "aggression".

items.title: Andhra Pradesh Governor says India lags behind in the participation of women in politics
items.summary: The law to reserve 33% of the seats in State Assemblies and in the Lok Sabha for women would now enable their greater participation in policy-making and equitable governance, Justice (Retd) Nazeer said

items.title: Watch: Why is Europe suddenly recognising Palestine amid Gaza crisis?
items.summary: Europe is seeing a rise in countries recognising Palestine, with Ireland, Norway, and Spain leading the way. The move follows the Gaza war, Israel’s rejection of a two-state solution, and mounting international pressure.

items.title: Priority will be to check ganja, drug peddling, says new Krishna SP
Greater Chennai Corporation deploys vehicles, equipment for Northeast monsoon preparedness
State government issues orders posting B. Ashok as Principal Secretary, Personnel and Administrative Reforms Department
Tamil Nadu Electricity Minister Sivasankar seeks a new comprehensive debt restructuring scheme for discoms
items.summary: In his special address at the Group of Ministers meeting of the State Electricity Ministers in New Delhi, he also calls for special grants under the 16th Finance Commission. He says that in the next five to seven years, Tamil Nadu will need over ₹2,00,000 crore in investment across generation, trans

items.title: ED files charge sheet against Chhattisgarh ex-CM Bhupesh Baghel’s son Chaitanya
items.summary: The case pertains to a loss of ₹2,161 crore to the State’s exchequer allegedly by a syndicate of senior bureaucrats, politicians, and excise department officials when Mr. Bhupesh was the Chief Minister.

items.title: Free medical camps at government centres from September 17
items.summary: Camps are organised as part of “Swasth Nari Sashakt Parivar Abhiyan”; as part of the programme, those above 18 years of age will be screened for common cancers and lifestyle diseases

items.title: Arpana’s long wait for a donor heart
items.summary: Arpana from Nepal reached India six months ago and has been waiting for a donor heart for the past four months, having registered in the organ transplant waiting list

items.title: Musk's language while addressing rally was abhorrent, says home secretary
items.summary: Shabana Mahmood says the tech billionaire "doesn't get to mess with British democracy" after Musk calls for dissolution of Parliament.

items.title: Insurance company officer sentenced to 10 years RI for misappropriating ₹5.3 crore
items.summary: A CBI Special Court convicts Administrative Officer (Accounts) of Oriental Insurance Co. Ltd., Divisional Office, T. Pradeep of misappropriation

items.title: Microfinance fraud case: HC dismisses plea to change probe officer
Quality not there - Scholes criticises Man Utd transfer strategy
items.summary: Manchester United legend Paul Scholes believes the club messed up badly with their summer transfer strategy and lack the "quality" needed to fit manager Ruben Amorim's controversial 3-4-3 system.

items.title: DC-style crackdown on crime coming to Memphis, Tennessee, Trump says
items.summary: Trump signs a proclamation establishing a task force to take on crime in the Democrat-let city despite opposition from its mayor.

items.title: India gets licence to scour new part of Indian Ocean for precious metals
items.summary: The government has signed a contract with International Seabed Authority to explore polymetallic sulphur nodules in the Carlsberg Ridge, a 3,00,000-sq km stretch that lies in the Indian Ocean

items.title: Another FIR against Yatnal for provocative speech
GBA Chief Commissioner directs officials to expedite pothole filling, road projects across Bengaluru
